intro: Zygia heteroneura, commonly known as the narrow-veined zygia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Zygia heteroneura is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
